articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Israeli strikes killed 22 people and injured more than 100 in central Beirut on Thursday, Lebanese authorities said, as a senior Hezbollah official evaded an Israeli assassination attempt in the city, according to three security sources.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 22 in Beirut as Hezoballah leader evades assassination

articles.author: Gwladys Fouche, Nora Buli
articles.description: Japanese organisation Nihon Hidankyo, a grassroots movement of atomic bomb survivors from Hiroshima and Nagasaki, won the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday, in a warning to countries who have nuclear weapons not to use them.
articles.title: Nobel Peace Prize 2024 goes to Japanese nuclear bombs survivors' movement Nihon Hidankyo

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kenya will send 600 more police officers to Haiti next month to bolster an international anti-gang mission, President William Ruto said on Friday during a visit by the Haitian prime minister intended to speed up deployments to the force.
articles.title: Kenya to send more police to Haiti after new gang attacks

articles.author: Adam Makary, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Thousands of people are trapped in Gaza's Jabalia camp as Israeli forces attack the area, Médecins Sans Frontières (Doctors Without Borders) said on Friday, a week after Israel began an offensive it says is aimed at stopping Hamas regrouping.
articles.title: Thousands said trapped in Jabalia camp as Israel escalates attacks in northern Gaza

articles.author: Aidan Lewis
articles.description: Medical charity MSF says it has been forced to suspend work in the vast camp for displaced people where famine has been confirmed in Sudan's North Darfur region, putting thousands of malnourished children at risk of death.
articles.title: MSF suspends support to famine-stricken camp in Sudan's Darfur

articles.author: Sakura Murakami
articles.description: A Japanese man who survived the nuclear bombing of Hiroshima and was decades later hugged by Barack Obama during the then U.S. President's visit to the city, said he hoped Friday's Nobel Peace Prize would help put a focus on nuclear disarmament.
articles.title: For Hiroshima survivor hugged by Obama, Nobel puts focus on denuclearisation

articles.author: Amina Ismail, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Residents of the central Beirut area hit by a deadly Israeli airstrike were still in shock on Friday amid the dust, rubble and broken glass, fearing that if their previously untargeted neighbourhood had been struck, nowhere in Lebanon was safe.
articles.title: Fear engulfs Beirut residents after Israel expands deadly strikes into city centre

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Leaders of nine European Union member states in the Mediterranean on Friday called for an immediate ceasefire after a sharp escalation in conflict between Israel and forces of Iran-backed Hezbollah in Lebanon.
articles.title: Leaders of EU states in Mediterranean say ceasefire in Middle East is needed, now

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: Han Kang, South Korea's first winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature, was slow to secure global acclaim, getting her first big international prize nine years after her best-known novel was published, once it had finally been translated into English.
articles.title: Han Kang's Nobel spurs hope of global recognition for Korean literature

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Hezbollah is preparing for a long war of attrition in south Lebanon, after Israel wiped out its top leadership, with a new military command directing rocket fire and the ground conflict, two sources familiar with its operations said.
articles.title: Hezbollah forges new command for crucial ground war after heavy Israeli blows
